channel.title: VLC on iOS(iPod Touch, iPhone, iPad)
channel.description:
Previously, it was only available on jailbroken devices, and to be honest it wasn't really that good.. But Videolan has just recently released an official version of VLC for iOS via the app store, and I have to say it really is pretty cool. It can play virtually any type of file(just like the desktop version), and you can transfer the files to the app directly through iTunes(no additional desktop software required)
I really think this is pretty big news. It's an entirely new sector for the idevices. Although I doubt they will remove it, I would grab it quick :)
http://www.macnewsworld.com/story/VLC-for-iPhone-Falls-Short-of-the-Desktop-Media-Marvel-71100.html

item.title: VLC on iOS(iPod Touch, iPhone, iPad)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ll start off by saying VLC rules, it’s great on all platforms.

And I guess this would be pretty big news if your phone could previously only play one, proprietary format. But for us with GOOD phones that come stock with the ability to play multiple formats, good job finally catching up, I guess.

Read full topic
item.source: VLC on iOS(iPod Touch, iPhone, iPad)
